feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and River in Juneau remain elevated and near bankfull due to previous days heavy rainfall. River levels are expected to drop late Thursday evening as no more heavy precipitation is forecast for the region. People living along the lake and river and any individuals recreating on these water
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH SATURDAY... Additional storm systems will move across Southcentral Alaska through the first half of the weekend. Widespread rain is expected Thursday evening through Friday morning, and again Friday evening into Saturday morning.

entry.summary: ...A High Surf Warning has been extended through Thursday... * WHAT...Surf of 15 to 18 feet * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Thursday * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 2:01PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai County through 230 PM MST... At 200 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Rimrock, or 15 miles east of Camp Verde. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins

entry.summary: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS POSSIBLE ACROSS EASTERN NORTH DAKOTA... Showers and thunderstorms have developed across eastern North Dakota this afternoon.
